TypeSignature.Value: public sealed class NumericShaper : Java.Lang.Object, IDisposable, Java.IO.ISerializable
.class public auto ansi sealed beforefieldinit NumericShaper extends Java.Lang.Object implements class Android.Runtime.IJavaObject, class Java.IO.ISerializable, class System.IDisposable

Docs.summary: The Class NumericShaper provides methods to convert latin character codes to unicode character codes.

remarks.para: The Class NumericShaper provides methods to convert latin character codes to unicode character codes. For tables of the character codes used, see .

MemberSignature.Value: .method public static hidebysig class Java.Awt.Font.NumericShaper GetContextualShaper(valuetype Java.Awt.Font.Ranges ranges) cil managed

Docs.summary: Gets the NumericShaper for the specified unicode ranges.

remarks.para: Gets the NumericShaper for the specified unicode ranges. The OR logical operation should be used for multiple ranges: NumericShaper.DEVANAGARI | NumericShaper.BENGALI. The NumericShaper returned by this method is contextual in that it supports multiple character ranges, depending on the context.

MemberSignature.Value: public static Java.Awt.Font.NumericShaper GetContextualShaper (Java.Awt.Font.Ranges ranges, int defaultContext);
.method public static hidebysig class Java.Awt.Font.NumericShaper GetContextualShaper(valuetype Java.Awt.Font.Ranges ranges, int32 defaultContext) cil managed

Docs.summary: Gets the NumericShaper for the specified unicode ranges and default unicode range.

remarks.para: Gets the NumericShaper for the specified unicode ranges and default unicode range. The defaultContext parameter is used as the starting context (which indicates the language/script being used). The OR logical operation should be used for multiple ranges: NumericShaper.DEVANAGARI | NumericShaper.BENGALI. The NumericShaper returned by this method is contextual in that it supports multiple character ranges, depending on the context.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public static hidebysig class Java.Awt.Font.NumericShaper GetShaper(valuetype Java.Awt.Font.Ranges singleRange) cil managed

Docs.summary: Gets a NumericShaper for the specified unicode range.

remarks.para: Gets a NumericShaper for the specified unicode range. The NumericShaper supports only a single range and hence is not contextual.

MemberSignature.Value: public void Shape (char[] text, int start, int count);
.method public hidebysig instance void Shape(char[] text, int32 start, int32 count) cil managed

Docs.param: the start offset of the text.
the number of characters to be shaped.
Docs.summary: Transforms the encoding of the text, starting from the character at index start and transforming count characters.

remarks.para: Transforms the encoding of the text, starting from the character at index start and transforming count characters.

MemberSignature.Value: public void Shape (char[] text, int start, int count, int context);
.method public hidebysig instance void Shape(char[] text, int32 start, int32 count, int32 context) cil managed

Docs.param: the start offset of the text.
the number of characters to be shaped.
the context to be used for shaping.
Docs.summary: Transforms the encoding of the text, starting from the character at index start and transforming count characters, using the specified context.

remarks.para: Transforms the encoding of the text, starting from the character at index start and transforming count characters, using the specified context.

Docs.value: A which contains the java.lang.Class JNI value corresponding to this type.

remarks.para: This property is used to control which jclass is provided to methods like .

Docs.summary: This API supports the Mono for Android infrastructure and is not intended to be used directly from your code.
Docs.value: A which provides the declaring type.

remarks.para: This property is used to control virtual vs. non virtual method dispatch against the underlying JNI object. When this property is equal to the declaring type, then virtual method invocation against the JNI object is performed; otherwise, we assume that the method was overridden by a derived type, and perform non-virtual methdo invocation.
